H0.text: Genetic drift is the process that can cause harmful alleles to become fixed.

H1.text: Natural selection is a process that can cause harmful alleles to become fixed.

H2.text: Migration is a process that can cause harmful alleles to become fixed.

H3.text: Mutation is the process that can cause harmful alleles to become fixed.

A4.text: Genetic drift may cause gene variants to disappear completely and thereby reduce genetic variation. It can also cause initially rare alleles to become much more frequent and even fixed.

A5.text: Disadvantageous mutations are usually eliminated quickly within the population
